reviews.text: It's an okey place to visit if you are near Batumi and have some time to kill. I couldn't find any exciting plants in the gardens, just ones that are mildly interesting. The park is pleasant enough and the best thing about it is the seaside location. Not bad, but also not exciting. The locals made its sound like it's the best botanical garden in the world, but, uh, that's definitely not true. The best way to get there is by taxi. Even though there are train stations nearby, they seem to be closed.

Definitely worth a visit. A 13 lari taxi from Batumi to get there. I went on a clear April day, which was just perfect. You can't buy any drinks inside the garden, only at the entrance, so make sure to take some refreshments.

I visited Batumi in the winter, January 17. At the day we visited this park, there was a heavy rain. However, we enjoyed it so much. It needs 1 day from morning to evening or like 8 am to 3 pm. A must to see place.

Electro buses are driving there all the time. They use paths which were designed for walking. You have to somehow give way to them as if you are standing on a busy street in a traffic. Why can't they just let people walk and enjoy the calming views, which are great, by the way?
Amazing garden with lots of different trees and flowers from all around the World and fantastic views to Black Seaside

Remnants of the main synagogue of Barcelona. Do not expect an actual synagogue, the Jewish community was forcefully converted in 1391, and it's main sites thoroughly destroyed. 
What remains of Jewish memory in Barcelona is scattered, and easy to overlook.
The hidden gem here are the guided visits the synagogue provides in Spanish, English, Hebrew, etc. They will help you to understand jewish life in medieval Barcelona.
They charge to go in so we didn't get past the front room. Looks cool though.
Worth a visit, €3.50 donation to enter. Quite small but full of fantastic history and staff give short speech on the jewish history and how it links in with Barcelona.

I had the pleasure to photograph a beautiful intimate wedding in the old Synagogue. I loved the atmosphere, the staff was very friendly, all prepared till a small little details for a perfect celebration.

We was not able to find the place on our first visit to Barcelona. It was around midnight in the middle of October - very common time for Barcelona to be out and explore place around. We wanted to find the Ancient Synagogue to be able to come here again at the day time. Interesting to say, at we were not alone, there was another couple trying to find the place - no luck. We returned next year at the day time,  we did it! It was worth the time and money to know the background of the Call carrer (Jewish community location in Barcelona).
I am studying here nd learning........
Very small museum with different exhibits. It’s dedicated to the history of Batumi’s oil industry. It’s cheap to visit the museum, and it takes about an hour to look through the composition.

THE NOBEL BROTHERS BATUMI TECHNOLOGICAL MUSEUM
The Nobel Brothers Batumi Technological Museumwas established in 2007 as the Legal Public Entity under the Ministry of Education, Culture and Sport of Adjara, Georgia. Museum represents the technical and technological achievements introduced to Batumi at the end of the 19th c and beginning of 20th c: activity of the Nobel Brothers, the Rotschilds, and Mantashev. There are 2 000 items stored there.

With Nobel Brothers help and activity the new technology of oil transit was implemented and Batumi was involved into the International Trade Affairs. There are exhibits on the development of tea culture, printing-house, and photography. In the museum there are the photos of Prokudin-Gorski - the first master of the color photography.

Working hours: Every day except Monday, 10.00 – 18.00

Ticket price: Adults -2GEL, Students – 1 GEL, Schoolchildren – 0.50 GEL

Free of charge: Children under 6 years of age and homeless children, soldiers, employers of Georgian and Foreign Museums, ICOM members, I and II category disabled persons.
Not bad I like it
Interesting.... Good to visit on a rainy day.
Very interesting exposition, take an excursion, it's cheap and insightful.
I had a fun time climbing around on the walls. Cool place totally enjoyable.
Very nice historical place. Would be nicer if they could clean the garbage left by previous visitors.
Not very much what to see, maybe at summer is more beautiful.

It's has fortress walls.. archelogical exploration is still under progress. You can go near to that exploration and watch. All excavated materials are kept open, you can touch lift.. no restrictions. One time visit. If you have free time.
Nice historical place and museum...

One of the great parks I have been to. Trees are old in age, lake is blue and beautiful, people are enjoying their time with peace of mind. What to stay away from traffic? Have a quick stop at this park for picnic  and enjoy the break.

Unforgettable landscape and atmosphere near the beach

Very nice park
Best place for walking and running 

Very nice statues and monuments
Very calm and cozy park for walking, fresh air and beautiful lake.
The park is great.  Is  huge, with beautiful lake. Many kids attractions
good place for rest. children also are welcome on this place. strongly reccomend.

Really today i came there was lady rude and told me not to order now 1 minute several times but at the same she was taking orders from other clients really unrespectful lady for that i put only one star.i didnt like u must improve your service

The staff did not serve us without any reason. They forgot our order and did not come to our table even considering the fact that we were looking straight in their eyes all the time. I do not recommend this place if you are longing for calm morning.

This little cafe has lots of variety of delicious little and big desserts all at reasonable prices. I got a cappuccino and a strawberry tart. Nice place, but the staff seemed a bit stressed. I'd come again.
Very delicious , different kind of sweets
Good
Its closed

Place is nice and located exactly on the Black sea coastline.  Atmosphere is beautiful   and personal is kind and helpful. But prices is overwhelming and food can be cooked better :) overall nice to go and see

The waiters had expectational service and were very friendly and understanding. Their barbecue food, pizza, and pasta pleased me and my family very well and it was great all around. The view was also really nice of the Batumi Beach.
Above the sea!!! I like this restaurant! Nice atmosphere and wonderful view. Waiters are a little slow 🐌 Prices are normal for a restaurant in the center of Batumi. Georgian cuisine is perfect 👌

Nice location with great ambience overlooking the sea on the boulevard. Decor, food and service is very good but music is way too loud to enjoy yourself. Dessert was really lacking as it appeared to be pre prepared and several days old. If you sit outside the music is tolerable
View of the sea makes this place special. Food is average, prices are bit high. Restrooms are clean. Personal is helpful. Live music is quite good.
